author: Special Correspondent
text:
Unorganised workers demand Welfare department be converted into a Board, during a demo in Puducherry on Friday.— Photo: S.S. Kumar

Activists of the Centre of Indian Trade Unions (CITU) on Friday staged a protest in front of the Legislative Assembly demanding the Unorganised Workers Welfare Department be converted as a Board and an allocation of Rs.10 crore to the Board for the welfare of unorganised labourers be made.

They also took out a procession from Old Bus Stand to protest against the government for adopting a discriminatory approach in distributing Deepavali incentives to workers from the unorganised sector.

Drivers of auto-rickshaws, tempo, vans, mini-load vehicles, roadside vendors and servant maids participated in the procession.

The police prevented them near Assembly from proceeding further and then the protesters shouted slogans demanding the government to implement their demands. Some police personnel assured them that they would get appointment for presenting their demands.

As the police did not do as they promised, the protesters broke the cordon and went inside the Assembly to protest.

Drivers of auto-rickshaws and tempos, roadside vendors, domestic helps participated
title: CITU’s unorganised labourers protest inside Assembly
